DOC.brief_summary: Numerous technique report enhance recovery follow intense exercise , however equivocal support claim . A novel technique neuromuscular electrical stimulation ( NMES ) via peroneal nerve show augment limb blood flow could enhance recovery follow exercise . The present study examine effect NMES , compare graduated compression sock muscle soreness , strength , marker muscle damage inflammation follow intense intermittent exercise .
DOC.brief_title: Neuromuscular Electrical Stimulation Via Peroneal Nerve Reduces Muscle Soreness Following Intermittent Exercise
DOC.criteria: healthy male currently play intermittent sport ( soccer , field hockey , rugby ) currently represent respective sport either university , county , national international level unhealthy male currently play intermittent sport ( soccer , field hockey , rugby ) currently represent respective sport either university , county , national international level individual indicate history cardiovascular , metabolic haematological disorder participant report sedentary lifestyle less three 30min physical activity session per week
